_header: That heart my heart hath in such grace
_description: Two Loving Hearts — six quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘For [wele or w]oo I wyll not fle / To love þat hart þat lovyth me’

CantLetters174.First Lines:
for [well or w?]oo I wyll not fleto love þat hart þat
                    lovyth meThat hart my hart hath in suche graceþat of too
                    hartes one hart make we…
CantLetters174.Last Lines:
…& kepe þis hart of my myne for thyneas
                    hart for hart for lovyng me
CantLetters174.Editions:
Historical Manuscripts Commission, Fifth Report, with Appendix.
         (1876): App., 458.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 302; 1977, 271.
Stevick,  Robert D.,
                        ed.  
             One Hundred Middle English Lyrics.
         Indianapolis: Bobbs-Merrill, 1964: 172-3.
